No executable code, no network calls, no file system access, no environment variable reading. Purely a reference guide for implementing browser fullscreen API functionality.

content.user_title: Add fullscreen toggle to web apps
content.value_statement: Need cross-browser fullscreen support for your web application. This skill provides complete patterns for implementing fullscreen toggle buttons, immersive display modes, and presentation views using the screenfull library with Angular.
actual_capabilities: Add basic fullscreen toggle buttons to any component
Implement fullscreen mode for specific DOM elements
Create fullscreen image and video viewers
Build presentation mode with keyboard navigation
Clean up event listeners and manage fullscreen state
limitations: Does not include fullscreen API polyfill for legacy browsers
No built-in mobile touch gestures for fullscreen
Does not provide pre-built UI components or icons
iOS Safari has limited fullscreen support for video elements only

faq.question: Which browsers support screenfull.js?
faq.answer: Chrome, Firefox, Safari, Edge, and Android Chrome have full support. iOS Safari has limited support for video elements only.

faq.question: What is the minimum screenfull version required?
faq.answer: This skill is designed for screenfull version 6.0.2 or higher as specified in the package.json dependency.

faq.question: How do I check if fullscreen is available?
faq.answer: Use screenfull.isEnabled boolean property. Always check this before calling toggle, request, or exit methods.

faq.question: Does this skill send any data externally?
faq.answer: No. This is a documentation skill with code examples. The screenfull library runs entirely in the browser and does not transmit data.

faq.question: Why is fullscreen not working on mobile?
faq.answer: Mobile browsers have limited fullscreen support. iOS Safari only allows fullscreen for video elements. Test on desktop browsers for full functionality.

faq.question: How does screenfull differ from native Fullscreen API?
faq.answer: Screenfull provides cross-browser compatibility by normalizing browser differences and handling vendor prefixes automatically.
